meanings.definition: The ability of a virus to undergo lysogeny.
meanings.sent1: The lysogenicity of the virus allows it to remain dormant within the host cell.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the lysogenicity of viruses to understand their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The lysogenicity of the virus was like a hidden superpower waiting to be unleashed.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was a lysogenicity, quietly biding its time before revealing its true strength.
meanings.sent5: The lysogenicity of the virus was like a secret agent, lying in wait for the perfect moment to strike.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being lysogenic.
meanings.sent1: The lysogenicity of the cell was evident in its ability to harbor the virus.
meanings.sent2: The lysogenicity of the environment favored the survival of the dormant virus.
meanings.sent3: The lysogenicity of the situation was like a calm before the storm, full of hidden potential.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a lysogenicity, holding onto memories until they were needed most.
meanings.sent5: The lysogenicity of the dormant volcano was a reminder of the power lying beneath the surface.
